eu.cqse.check.framework.shallowparser.framework

Class RecognizerBase<STATE extends java.lang.Enum<STATE>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.cqse.check.framework.shallowparser.framework.RecognizerBase<STATE>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ArrayBracketsRecognizer, CppLambdaRecognizer, CppSkipTemplateSpecificationRecognizer, JavaLikeAnonymousClassRecognizer, LineBasedStatementRecognizerBase, ModuleBlockStartRecognizer, PreconditionRecognizer, RustSubExpressionRecognizer, SequenceRecognizer, SubRecognizer, XtendSkipToEndOfStatementRecognizer, YuiCallRecognizer

    public abstract class RecognizerBase<STATE extends java.lang.Enum<STATE>>
extends java.lang.Object
    A node used for recognizing a part of the system. The parsers constructed work by trying a list of recognizers and "using" the first that matches. Recognizers can be chained to match more complicated patterns and allow branching.

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int NO_MATCH
      Constant used to indicate that no match occurred.

      Parses zero or more times until the following recognizer can match.

      Parses zero or more times until the following recognizer can match or the end of file is reached.

    • Method Detail

      • sequence

        public RecognizerBase<STATE> sequence(java.lang.Object... matchTerms)
        Creates a recognizer for a certain sequence and moves the offset to the end of the match.
        Parameters:
        matchTerms - a list of match terms which must match in order. These may be instances of ETokenType, ETokenType.ETokenClass, or sets of them.

      • sequenceBefore

        public RecognizerBase<STATE> sequenceBefore(java.lang.Object... matchTerms)
        Creates a recognizer for a certain sequence and moves the offset to the beginning of the match (in contrast to sequence(Object...), which moves the offset to the end of the match). This is useful to implement branches in the parser.
        Parameters:
        matchTerms - a list of match terms which must match in order. These may be instances of ETokenType, ETokenType.ETokenClass, or sets of them.

      • repeated

        public RecognizerBase<STATE> repeated(java.lang.Object... matchTerms)
        Creates a recognizer that matches a certain sequence repeatedly (including no matches).
        Parameters:
        matchTerms - a list of match terms which must match in order. These may be instances of ETokenType, ETokenType.ETokenClass, or sets of them.

      • repeatedAtLeastOnce

        public RecognizerBase<STATE> repeatedAtLeastOnce(java.lang.Object... matchTerms)
        Creates a recognizer that matches a certain sequence repeatedly, provided that at least one match occurs.
        Parameters:
        matchTerms - a list of match terms which must match in order. These may be instances of ETokenType, ETokenType.ETokenClass, or sets of them.

      • subRecognizer

        public RecognizerBase<STATE> subRecognizer(RecognizerBase<STATE> sub,
                                           int minRepetitions,
                                           int maxRepetitions)
        Creates a recognizer that matches the given sub-recognizer the given number of times. Note that you cannot use this method with a recognizer that does not advance the parser state. Use preCondition(RecognizerBase) instead.

      • subRecognizer

        public RecognizerBase<STATE> subRecognizer(RecognizerBase<STATE> sub)
        Creates a recognizer that matches the given sub recognizer exactly one time. Note that you cannot use this method with a recognizer that does not advance the parser state. Use preCondition(RecognizerBase) instead.

      • optionalSubRecognizer

        public RecognizerBase<STATE> optionalSubRecognizer(RecognizerBase<STATE> sub)
        Creates a recognizer that matches the given sub recognizer zero or one times. Note that you cannot use this method with a recognizer that does not advance the parser state. Use preCondition(RecognizerBase) instead.

      • repeatedSubRecognizer

        public RecognizerBase<STATE> repeatedSubRecognizer(RecognizerBase<STATE> sub)
        Creates a recognizer that matches the given sub recognizer an arbitrary number of times. Note that you cannot use this method with a recognizer that does not advance the parser state. Use preCondition(RecognizerBase) instead.

      • preCondition

        public RecognizerBase<STATE> preCondition(RecognizerBase<STATE> sub)
        Creates a recognizer that matches the given sub-recognizer once but does not advance the parser state. This can be used to check if the given recognizer would apply at the current position and then perform other actions first, e.g. close the current node.

      • optional

        public RecognizerBase<STATE> optional(java.lang.Object... matchTerms)
        Creates a recognizer that matches a certain sequence optionally.
        Parameters:
        matchTerms - a list of match terms which must match in order. These may be instances of ETokenType, ETokenType.ETokenClass, or sets of them.

      • skipForward

        public RecognizerBase<STATE> skipForward(int numberOfTokensToSkip)
        Creates a recognizer that skips a given number of tokens.
        Parameters:
        numberOfTokensToSkip - The number of tokens to skip.

      • skipTo

        public RecognizerBase<STATE> skipTo(java.lang.Object... matchTerms)
        Creates a recognizer that skips until the given match terms are found. The new position is set behind the found match.
        Parameters:
        matchTerms - a list of match terms which must match in order. These may be instances of ETokenType, ETokenType.ETokenClass, or sets of them.

      • skipBefore

        public RecognizerBase<STATE> skipBefore(java.lang.Object... matchTerms)
        Creates a recognizer that skips until the given match terms are found. The new position is set directly before the found match.
        Parameters:
        matchTerms - a list of match terms which must match in order. These may be instances of ETokenType, ETokenType.ETokenClass, or sets of them.

      • skipNested

        public RecognizerBase<STATE> skipNested(eu.cqse.check.framework.scanner.ETokenType open,
                                        eu.cqse.check.framework.scanner.ETokenType close)
        Skips a region consisting of nested elements if it exists (i.e., the skipping is optional).

      • skipNested

        public RecognizerBase<STATE> skipNested(eu.cqse.check.framework.scanner.ETokenType open,
                                        eu.cqse.check.framework.scanner.ETokenType close,
                                        RecognizerBase<STATE> subRecognizer)
        Skips a region consisting of nested elements if it exists (i.e., the skipping is optional). The skipped region will be processed by the given subRecognizer (may be null), which can optionally create further entities.

      • skipAny

        public RecognizerBase<STATE> skipAny(java.util.EnumSet<eu.cqse.check.framework.scanner.ETokenType> types)
        Skips all tokens that are of one of the given types (if any).

      • skipToWithNesting

        public RecognizerBase<STATE> skipToWithNesting(java.lang.Object matchTerm,
                                               eu.cqse.check.framework.scanner.ETokenType open,
                                               eu.cqse.check.framework.scanner.ETokenType close)
        Skips all tokens up to the given match term. If the match term occurs within a nested structure, it is ignored.

      • skipToWithNesting

        public RecognizerBase<STATE> skipToWithNesting(java.lang.Object matchTerm,
                                               eu.cqse.check.framework.scanner.ETokenType open,
                                               eu.cqse.check.framework.scanner.ETokenType close,
                                               RecognizerBase<STATE> subRecognizer)
        Skips all tokens up to the given match term. If the match term occurs within a nested structure, it is ignored. The skipped region will be processed by the given subRecognizer (may be null), which can optionally create further entities.

      • skipToWithNesting

        public RecognizerBase<STATE> skipToWithNesting(java.lang.Object matchTerm,
                                               java.util.List<eu.cqse.check.framework.scanner.ETokenType> openingTokens,
                                               java.util.List<eu.cqse.check.framework.scanner.ETokenType> closingTokens)
        Skips all tokens up to the given match term. If the match term occurs within a nested structure, it is ignored.

      • skipToWithNesting

        public RecognizerBase<STATE> skipToWithNesting(java.lang.Object matchTerm,
                                               java.util.List<eu.cqse.check.framework.scanner.ETokenType> openingTokens,
                                               java.util.List<eu.cqse.check.framework.scanner.ETokenType> closingTokens,
                                               RecognizerBase<STATE> subRecognizer)
        Skips all tokens up to the given match term. If the match term occurs within a nested structure, it is ignored. The skipped region will be processed by the given subRecognizer (may be null), which can optionally create further entities.

      • skipBeforeWithNesting

        public RecognizerBase<STATE> skipBeforeWithNesting(java.lang.Object matchTerm,
                                                   eu.cqse.check.framework.scanner.ETokenType open,
                                                   eu.cqse.check.framework.scanner.ETokenType close)
        Skips all tokens up to the given match term. If the match term occurs within a nested structure, it is ignored. The new position is set directly before the found match.

      • skipBeforeWithNesting

        public RecognizerBase<STATE> skipBeforeWithNesting(java.lang.Object matchTerm,
                                                   eu.cqse.check.framework.scanner.ETokenType open1,
                                                   eu.cqse.check.framework.scanner.ETokenType close1,
                                                   eu.cqse.check.framework.scanner.ETokenType open2,
                                                   eu.cqse.check.framework.scanner.ETokenType close2)
        Skips all tokens up to the given match term. If the match term occurs within a nested structure, it is ignored. The new position is set directly before the found match.

      • skipBeforeWithNesting

        public RecognizerBase<STATE> skipBeforeWithNesting(java.lang.Object matchTerm,
                                                   eu.cqse.check.framework.scanner.ETokenType open1,
                                                   eu.cqse.check.framework.scanner.ETokenType close1,
                                                   eu.cqse.check.framework.scanner.ETokenType open2,
                                                   eu.cqse.check.framework.scanner.ETokenType close2,
                                                   RecognizerBase<STATE> subRecognizer)
        Skips all tokens up to the given match term. If the match term occurs within a nested structure, it is ignored. The new position is set directly before the found match. The skipped region will be processed by the given subRecognizer (may be null), which can optionally create further entities.

      • skipBeforeWithNesting

        public RecognizerBase<STATE> skipBeforeWithNesting(java.lang.Object matchTerm,
                                                   java.util.List<eu.cqse.check.framework.scanner.ETokenType> openingTokens,
                                                   java.util.List<eu.cqse.check.framework.scanner.ETokenType> closingTokens)
        Skips all tokens up to the given match term. If the match term occurs within a nested structure, it is ignored. The new position is set directly before the found match.

      • skipBeforeWithNesting

        public RecognizerBase<STATE> skipBeforeWithNesting(java.lang.Object matchTerm,
                                                   java.util.List<eu.cqse.check.framework.scanner.ETokenType> openingTokens,
                                                   java.util.List<eu.cqse.check.framework.scanner.ETokenType> closingTokens,
                                                   RecognizerBase<STATE> subRecognizer)
        Skips all tokens up to the given match term. If the match term occurs within a nested structure, it is ignored. The new position is set directly before the found match. The skipped region will be processed by the given subRecognizer (may be null), which can optionally create further entities.

      • skipWithNesting

        public RecognizerBase<STATE> skipWithNesting(java.lang.Object matchTerm,
                                             java.util.List<eu.cqse.check.framework.scanner.ETokenType> openingTokens,
                                             java.util.List<eu.cqse.check.framework.scanner.ETokenType> closingTokens,
                                             RecognizerBase<STATE> subRecognizer,
                                             boolean reportStartOfEndMatch)
        Skips all tokens up to the given match term. If the match term occurs within a nested structure, it is ignored. If reportStartOfEndMatch is true, the new position is set directly before the found match, otherwise after it. The skipped region will be processed by the given subRecognizer (may be null), which can optionally create further entities.

      • markStart

        public RecognizerBase<STATE> markStart()
        Marks a different matching start position, which can be used to reference tokens during node creation.

      • createNode

        public RecognizerBase<STATE> createNode(EShallowEntityType type,
                                        java.lang.Object subtype)
        Creates a shallow parser entity node without a name.
        Parameters:
        subtype - this may be either a string which is used directly, or an integer which is interpreted as an offset into the tokens matched so far. The index may also be negative, which means that the matching occurs from the end. If an array is provided, the entries of the array are treated as described and concatenated with spaces. If a Region is given, the start and end values define a range of indexes.

      • createNode

        public RecognizerBase<STATE> createNode(EShallowEntityType type,
                                        java.lang.Object subtype,
                                        java.lang.Object name)
        Creates a shallow parser entity node.
        Parameters:
        subtype - this may be either a string which is used directly, or an integer which is interpreted as an offset into the tokens matched so far. The index may also be negative, which means that the matching occurs from the end. If an array is provided, the entries of the array are treated as described and concatenated with spaces. If a Region is given, the start and end values define a range of indexes.
        name - this may be either null, a string which is used directly, or an integer which is interpreted as an offset into the tokens matched so far. The index may also be negative, which means that the matching occurs from the end. If an array is provided, the entries of the array are treated as described and concatenated with spaces. If a Region is given, the start and end values define a range of indexes. If a INameResolver is given INameResolver.resolveName(ParserState, List, int) will be called instead.

      • createNode

        public RecognizerBase<STATE> createNode(EShallowEntityType type,
                                        java.lang.Object subtype,
                                        java.lang.Object name,
                                        int offset)
        Creates a shallow parser entity node, offsetting the node start by the given amount of tokens to the right.
        Parameters:
        subtype - this may be either a string which is used directly, or an integer which is interpreted as an offset into the tokens matched so far. The index may also be negative, which means that the matching occurs from the end. If an array is provided, the entries of the array are treated as described and concatenated with spaces. If a Region is given, the start and end values define a range of indexes.
        name - this may be either null, a string which is used directly, or an integer which is interpreted as an offset into the tokens matched so far. The index may also be negative, which means that the matching occurs from the end. If an array is provided, the entries of the array are treated as described and concatenated with spaces. If a Region is given, the start and end values define a range of indexes. If a INameResolver is given INameResolver.resolveName(ParserState, List, int) will be called instead.
        offset - an offset in the token stream. Moves the node start that many tokens to the right.

      • endNode

        public void endNode()
        Completes node construction.

      • endNodeWithName

        public void endNodeWithName(java.lang.Object name)
        Completes node construction and overrides the name of the current node. This can be used for long constructs where the name is found at the end.

      • endNodeWithContinuation

        public void endNodeWithContinuation()
        Completes node construction and signals that this parsed node is only a partial language construct, i.e. parsing should in any case continue at the same level.

      • parseUntil

        public RecognizerBase<STATE> parseUntil(STATE state)
        Parses zero or more times until the following recognizer can match.

      • parseUntilOrEof

        public RecognizerBase<STATE> parseUntilOrEof(STATE state)
        Parses zero or more times until the following recognizer can match or the end of file is reached.

      • parseStrictlyUntil

        public RecognizerBase<STATE> parseStrictlyUntil(STATE state)
        Parses strictly with the region delimited by the tail recognizers.

      • parseOnce

        public RecognizerBase<STATE> parseOnce(STATE state)
        Attempts to parse exactly once in the given state.

      • ensureTopLevel

        public RecognizerBase<STATE> ensureTopLevel()
        Matches if the parser is currently parsing on the top-level.

      • matches

        public int matches(ParserState<STATE> parserState,
                   java.util.List<IToken> tokens,
                   int startOffset)
        Attempts to match the recognizer including any tail recognizers.
        Parameters:
        tokens - the list of tokens.
        startOffset - the current offset into the tokens from where to start matching.
        Returns:
        the new offset (position right behind the match) or NO_MATCH if matching was not possible at this position.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This default implementation returns the class of this recognizer and the string representation of all tailRecognizers.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
